body.p: SnagIt features various image formatting and annotation options. Below are selected examples to familiarize yourself with major features. For thorough descriptions of all features, reference TechSmith's available documentation and video tutorials

strow.stentry: Points out a specific feature or area within the image
Emphasizes a certain element within the content
Details the action to be taken, or in the case of a software bug, identifies what is supposed to occur
Highlights an object referenced in the body of yoursupport ticket
Removes an irrelevant portion of the image, or joins together disconnected content
Remove portions of the graphic entirely, or reverse an edit you already made

p.b: Optimizing SnagIt for the Support Associate role at XYZ Company

body.p: Although the development team writes the database scripts behind the scenes that keep our software running, they will not always be as expert as you from the UI perspective. So, while your ticket may seem obvious, do not look past some of the ways SnagIt can minimize misinterpretation and drive home a point. Let's explore specific features from the preceding list you will access often in your role, and describe the scenarios where they will be most useful

ul.li: Cut Out - Cut Out will prove especially helpful when Clients request an enhancement to the UI. With Cut Out, you can assist developers in visualizing how they should best approach the ticket and demonstrate how the end result should appear

Text - Text is one of SnagIt's more versatile effects. If a Client reports a software bug, development will need to understand exactly which area is malfunctioning, and sometimes objects (such as an arrow) cannot fully depict the error. Text is also handy in telling a User's story. In other words, describing the sequence of events behind the User's ultimate goal
